title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 April 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:28 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki

09:51 <vmassol1> Denis1, sdumitriu: could you check this please http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1154?  
09:51 <vmassol1> this is the last item blocking the release AFAIK  
09:51 <@sdumitriu> Not loading for me  
09:52 <+tmortagne> remove the ?  
09:52 <+tmortagne> (I guess)  
09:52 <+tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1154 works well for me  
09:52 <@sdumitriu> Loaded now  
09:52 <polx> has quit  
09:53 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <@sdumitriu> Looks different from XWIKI-7564  
09:56 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <@sdumitriu> And the log isn't too helpful, "Call getNextException to see the cause."  
10:01 <polx> has quit  
10:03 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <@sdumitriu> Ah, I know...  
10:09 <@sdumitriu> The migrator is only supposed to run on pre-3.3 versions, there's no need to run it on 3.5  
10:09 <@sdumitriu> vmassol1, Denis1: I see two options:  
10:09 <polx> has quit  
10:09 <@sdumitriu> A. Add a check on xwiki.getVersion, since database version doesn't help  
10:10 <@sdumitriu> B. Ignore the exception and assume everything is OK  
10:11 <+tmortagne> xwiki.getVersion is supposed to be the version of the product, not the version of platform so it sounds a bit risky to me  
10:11 <@sdumitriu> Or maybe C, tell users to manually exclude this migrator if they're in this particular case, upgrading from [3.3, 3.5] to 3.5.1 or 4.0  
10:11 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: I agree  
10:12 <+tmortagne> why don't the database version help ?  
10:12 <@sdumitriu> Because we had no migrator between 3.3 and 3.5, so the version will be the same for both cases  
10:13 <@sdumitriu> That is, 15428  
10:13 <+tmortagne> ok  
10:14 <+tmortagne> there is not way to write the migrator in a way that will make it pass if it's useless ?  
10:14 <+tmortagne> like other migrators  
10:15 <+tmortagne> (did not really check what's it's doing)  
10:15 <vmassol1> that' really the best, I don't like any non automatic solution for the users;it's going to cause us trouble  
10:15 <vmassol1> IMO we always have choice, at worst we can check an existing document's id and verify what algo it's using for its id  
10:16 <vmassol1> (I also haven't checked the code)  
10:21 <@sdumitriu> This isn't about IDs  
10:21 <@sdumitriu> It's about attachments  
10:21 <@sdumitriu> And the fact that before 3.3 they were stored inline, and now they're stored as external LOBs  
10:22 <@sdumitriu> The migrator tries to move the data from inline data to LOBs  
10:22 <@sdumitriu> But in [3.3, 3.5] the data is already stored as LOBs  
10:22 <@sdumitriu> And we can't easily determine how the data is stored  
10:23 <@sdumitriu> We could try to analyze the table  
10:23 <@sdumitriu> But IMO it's pretty safe to just catch the exception and ignore it, since it means that the data doesn't need migration  
10:23 <@sdumitriu> Too sleepy, going to bed  
10:24 <vmassol1> so we need to hold the release?  
10:24 <vmassol1> maybe Denis1 can help  
10:24 <@sdumitriu> If we want to be nice to users, yes  
10:24 <vmassol1> we're lagging by exactly one week ATM  
10:25 <vmassol1> I'd like that we cut the release ASAP  
10:25 <@sdumitriu> By the way, the 3.5.1 release isn't done yet, tmortagne modified the release script to change the ci profile to legacy, but the stable-3.5.x branch still uses the ci profile  
10:25 <@sdumitriu> So the installers weren't build  
10:25 <@sdumitriu> I'll have to redo the 3.5.1 release anyway  
10:25 <vmassol1> ah…. not good  
10:25 <jvdrean> has quit  
10:25 <vmassol1> guillaume was expecting it last week, I'll ltell hil  
10:25 <vmassol1> sdumitriu:  when can you do this?  
10:25 <vmassol1> (3.5.1)  
10:26 <@sdumitriu> As soon as we fix the migration issue  
10:26 <@sdumitriu> It affects 3.5.1 as well  
10:26 <vmassol1> ok….  
10:26 <@sdumitriu> If Denis1 has time to look at it, then I can start the release after I wake up  
10:26 <@sdumitriu> If not, I'll fix the issue first, then release  
10:26 <vmassol1> ok  
10:26 <vmassol1> I'll try to get hold on denis  
10:27 <@sdumitriu> Sleep time for me  
10:27 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <vmassol1> nn sdumitriu  
10:30 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <polx> has quit

10:48 <CIA-160> tmortagne master \* rc8aa989 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c8aa989c146347812920a92287f8a55b2540bfa5 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7155: Upgrade to JGroups 3 - http://git.io/NahD-A  
10:53 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <CIA-160> Vincent Massol master \* r6664aef https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/6664aefe36be58c14c7e53afcde163b66db97184 / (9 files in 6 dirs): XCOMMONS-153: Add Groovy Module - http://git.io/Zlpnzw  
11:01 <CIA-160> Vincent Massol master \* r933f974 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/933f974ad5ed7e9ef851c21f81a4a979924ada1c / xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resources/src/main/resources/xwiki.properties.vm : [Misc] Added missing configuration documentation for the Velocity Macro - http://git.io/IcRwXw  
11:01 <CIA-160> Vincent Massol master \* rea26ed4 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ea26ed4fc4bd7201e8ce35e7e3d5312b70cdd9f2 / (6 files in 5 dirs): XWIKI-7755: Add ability to use Compilation Customizers in the Groovy Macro - http://git.io/jyVXGg  
11:05 <+sburjan> hello everybody  
11:08 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <npm\_> has quit  
11:25 <+tmortagne> sburjan: Hi  
11:25 <+tmortagne> just seen that http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise40RC1#HTestedBrowsers was not done, would be nice if you could take care of it  
11:26 <+sburjan> tmortagne: doing it now  
11:26 <+sburjan> I was in vacation when it was released  
11:26 <+tmortagne> ok thanks, for 4.0 you test it with the released version of you do it with the last snapshot before the release ? I don't remember  
11:28 <+sburjan> you're asking about db migrations ?  
11:28 <polx> has quit  
11:30 <+sburjan> tmortagne: done  
11:31 <+tmortagne> sburjan: thanks  
11:31 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I was talking about when you update the release note  
11:32 <+tmortagne> i.e. is it based on snapshot version of you wait for the version to be released to do test on it  
11:32 <+sburjan> I test on the latest snapshot  
11:32 <+tmortagne> ok  
11:32 <+sburjan> are you releasing today ?  
11:33 <+tmortagne> hope so but http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1154 is still blocking the release  
11:33 <+tmortagne> so waiting for Denis right now  
11:33 <+tmortagne> or anyone willing to fix it  
11:33 <+sburjan> I tested annotation migration on 4.1 because Edy forgot to comit to 4.0.x, but I'd like to test it on 4.0.x branch too  
11:34 <+sburjan> I think it has been already fixed, the issue is about 4.0 RC1, and it has been fied, but I will perform a re-test on migrations too today  
11:35 <+sburjan> afaik the issue you pasted is a duplicate of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7712 .. but you should wait for Denis to be sure  
11:37 <+sburjan> I see latest 4.0 snapshot is from friday .. hope it contains the last commits Edy made  
11:42 <+tmortagne> sburjan: no it's not  
11:43 <+tmortagne> (10:07:37 AM) sdumitriu: Ah, I know...  
11:43 <+tmortagne> (10:08:05 AM) sdumitriu: The migrator is only supposed to run on pre-3.3 versions, there's no need to run it on 3.5  
11:43 <+sburjan> ok, I missed that  
11:43 <+tmortagne> you were not yet connected with this user I think  
12:01 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
12:02 <CIA-160> tmortagne master \* rce6cee4 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/ce6cee4dfd31a84ae6dbea425882ac4e5c263c18 / xwiki-enterprise-database/pom.xml : XE-1155: R40001XWIKI7540 migration is executed at first startup in hsqldb/jetty distribution - http://git.io/oeK-Ew  
12:02 <CIA-160> tmortagne stable-4.0.x \* rbeb8419 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/beb8419a0bdb352812d38571890ca6faad4d7f85 / xwiki-enterprise-database/pom.xml : XE-1155: R40001XWIKI7540 migration is executed at first startup in hsqldb/jetty distribution - http://git.io/3zHdwA  
12:04 <+sburjan> tmortagne: I guess you recommend me to wait until the build with this commit is included  
12:05 <+tmortagne> sburjan: this one is not a bid deal but anyway there will be XE-1154  
12:05 <+sburjan> I test migrations from 2.7.2, so I wouldn't catch XE-1154  
12:07 <+sburjan> tmortagne:  so this means 3.5.1 will also be affected bt XE-1154 ?  
12:07 <+tmortagne> sburjan: from what sdumitriu said yes seems so  
12:07 <+tmortagne> so 3.5.1 is stuck too  
12:08 <+sburjan> so we didn't announced it yet ?  
12:08 <+tmortagne> (10:24:09 AM) sdumitriu: By the way, the 3.5.1 release isn't done yet, tmortagne modified the release script to change the ci profile to legacy, but the stable-3.5.x branch still uses the ci profile  
12:09 <+tmortagne> (10:24:14 AM) sdumitriu: So the installers weren't build  
12:09 <+tmortagne> (10:24:21 AM) sdumitriu: I'll have to redo the 3.5.1 release anyway  
12:09 <+tmortagne> (10:24:42 AM) vmassol1: sdumitriu:  when can you do this?  
12:09 <+tmortagne> (10:24:49 AM) vmassol1: (3.5.1)  
12:09 <+tmortagne> (10:25:09 AM) sdumitriu: As soon as we fix the migration issue  
12:09 <+tmortagne> (10:25:15 AM) sdumitriu: It affects 3.5.1 as well  
12:09 <+tmortagne> he, you have everything :)  
12:10 <+Denis> tmortagne: Hi, the migration issue he talk about is XE-1154 ?  
12:10 <+tmortagne> yes  
12:10 <+tmortagne> the issue is a migration which is failing  
12:10 <+Denis> why do you need my help ?  
12:11 <+tmortagne> it's failing because it's actually useless  
12:11 <+tmortagne> Denis: for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1154  
12:11 <+Denis> do you know the goal of it ?  
12:11 <+tmortagne> not much  
12:11 <+tmortagne> I think it's about attachments  
12:12 <+tmortagne> let me copy/paste what sdumitriu said about it  
12:12 <+Denis> yes, it is migration 35100  
12:12 <+tmortagne> (10:20:12 AM) sdumitriu: It's about attachments  
12:12 <+tmortagne> (10:20:36 AM) sdumitriu: And the fact that before 3.3 they were stored inline, and now they're stored as external LOBs  
12:12 <+tmortagne> (10:21:09 AM) sdumitriu: The migrator tries to move the data from inline data to LOBs  
12:12 <+tmortagne> (10:21:31 AM) sdumitriu: But in [3.3, 3.5] the data is already stored as LOBs  
12:12 <+tmortagne> (10:21:53 AM) sdumitriu: And we can't easily determine how the data is stored  
12:12 <+tmortagne> (10:22:14 AM) sdumitriu: We could try to analyze the table  
12:12 <+tmortagne> (10:22:44 AM) sdumitriu: But IMO it's pretty safe to just catch the exception and ignore it, since it means that the data doesn't need migration  
12:12 <+tmortagne> (10:22:53 AM) sdumitriu: Too sleepy, going to bed  
12:16 <+Denis> I really wonder than, why the migration is 35100 ?  
12:42 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
12:47 <mflorea> has quit  
12:48 <+Denis> tmortagne: I do not have enough information about the goals, I cannot help much without talking to sdumitriu first.  
12:57 <vmassol1> Denis: the goal is that the migration should work whatever the version of XE you're running  
12:57 <vmassol1> Denis: you can check the IRC log for today, you'll see all the details  
13:02 <+sburjan> Denis: I can try to reproduce the issue on Postgres  
13:02 <+sburjan> have a 3.3 migrated to 3.5.1  
13:31 <CIA-160> Vincent Massol master \* rdcd6aff https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/dcd6aff838df028ca4f126073aafd3dc05c24c39 / (5 files in 4 dirs): XCOMMONS-154: Allow stopping Groovy scripts if they take longer that a given time to execute - http://git.io/KszvSQ  
13:36 <CIA-160> Vincent Massol master \* raa14c03 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/aa14c03180f5e1cb39e1c7679f0ce1144a229057 / xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resources/src/main/resources/xwiki.properties.vm : XCOMMONS-154: Allow stopping Groovy scripts if they take longer that a given time to execute - http://git.io/o6OfYA  
13:38 <vmassol1> just coded this fyi http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-154?focusedCommentId=70233#comment-70233  
13:38 <vmassol1> neat, isn't it? :)  
13:38 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:04 <jvdrean> has quit  
14:05 <+sburjan> was looking at the content of xwikiattachment table on postgres, and in the author column (xwa\_author) I see we have xwiki.Admin and xwiki:XWiki.Admin. is this normal ? I knew we want to have everywhere XEM based users  
14:07 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <polx> has quit  
14:38 <vmassol1> sburjan: fyi nice list of what they have tested on http://docs.codehaus.org/display/SONAR/Install+Sonar  
14:38 <vmassol1> (browsers, dbs, app servers)  
14:38 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
14:39 <+sburjan> yes, looks nice  
14:40 <+sburjan> do you want to modify or current macros (browser and database) to be similar with these one ?  
14:41 <vmassol> wdym?  
14:42 <+sburjan> I mean the tales look nice and clean, but I think that ours are nice too :)  
14:42 <@cjd\_> It's clean and definitely "the java way" but it might be easier just to be consice and solve the problem at hand.  
14:42 <cjd\_> is now known as <cjd>  
14:42 <vmassol> sburjan: oh it's not a question of look :)  
14:43 <vmassol> I'm wondering if people who go to the xwiki install get this kind of information  
14:43 <+Denis> vmassol: what I do not understand, is when and why this change occurs ?  
14:43 <vmassol> sburjan: we kind of have it in the RN but I'm not sure we have it visible on the download or install pages. Would need to check  
14:43 <vmassol> sburjan: anyway I wasn't suggesitng anything. Just found this page and thought we were working in the same direction  
14:44 <+Denis> if we could determine more precisely when the change had happen in comparison to the db version, we may simply improve when the migration is executed  
14:44 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <+Denis> determining if the db is already updated or not, is less easy, and out of my knowledge  
14:45 <+sburjan> vmassol: we don't have that in the download page, nor in the InstallationStandalone. I'm talking about this kind of info. It would be a good idea to integrate it somehow  
14:47 <@cjd> Jamie's solution to XWIKI-7748 uses FileCleaningTracker and we would need to verify that it does what we want (.deleteOnExit() doesn't so it's not as trivial as it might seem). I think the best answer given the age of most of this code is just to put the temp files in a "delete-on-exit" directory and delete it every time the system shuts down, that way if it's missed one time around, it will be gotten the next.  
14:48 <@cjd> For a longer term solution, I would think a nice Provider<File> which outputs temporary files would be the answer, I'd still use the same backend since it's simple.  
14:48 <vmassol> cjd: hmm we should do this in commons-environment when setting up the tmp dir I guess  
14:49 <vmassol> (ie when the app is stopped all tmp dir is cleaned - might be a bit dangerous maybe, not sure)  
14:49 <@cjd> That's why I suggest having a subdirectory of things we \*know\* we want to be cleaned.  
14:50 <@cjd> tmpdir/to-delete/file.txt  
14:51 <@cjd> OTOH not wiping the temp dir every time is exchanging an obvious bug for a subtle one  
14:51 <@cjd> (if there is code which depends on the tmpdir)  
14:52 <blackbird\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:53 <blackbird\_> hello, how can I write custom templates to individually view my application-within-a-minute entries?  
14:53 <blackbird\_> and: how can I include app items content into other pages?  
15:06 <npm\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:15 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think there's a problem in the release script  
15:15 <vmassol> if you check the tags for xwiki-commons  
15:15 <vmassol> you'll see xwiki-commons-40 and xwiki-commons-41  
15:16 <vmassol> it should be xwiki-commons-4.0 and 4.1 instead  
15:16 <+tmortagne> no  
15:16 <+tmortagne> that's old stuff  
15:16 <vmassol> I don't think so  
15:16 <+tmortagne> it is  
15:16 <+tmortagne> 4.1 has never been released  
15:16 <+tmortagne> or 4.0  
15:17 <+tmortagne> so you are not going to find them  
15:17 <vmassol> indeed good point  
15:17 <vmassol> so I wonder what those are  
15:17 <vmassol> because when you check them out  
15:17 <+tmortagne> xwiki-commons-40 is old versinning of root pom  
15:17 <vmassol> they have the same structure  
15:17 <+tmortagne> comming from svn  
15:18 <vmassol> we didn' thave xwiki-commons before  
15:18 <vmassol> when we were using svn  
15:18 <vmassol> I don't understand  
15:18 <+tmortagne> ihttps://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/tree/xwiki-commons-40  
15:18 <+tmortagne> I see only xwiki-commons-pom  
15:19 <+tmortagne> maybe it was for 3.0 release or something like that  
15:19 <vmassol> strange  
15:19 <+tmortagne> when we were still moving but needed to release minor versions  
15:20 <vmassol> ok….  
15:20 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
15:21 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
15:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok thanks, mystery solved  
15:28 <blackbird\_> how can I write custom templates to individually view my application-within-a-minute entries?  
15:28 <blackbird\_> and: how can I include app items content into other pages?  
15:29 <vmassol> blackbird\_: I had seen your questions above but I don't understand them :)  
15:32 <+sburjan> vmassol: can we setup this week the Jenkins IE8 slave ?  
15:33 <+sburjan> Denis: I am not able to reproduce XE-1154 using 3.5.1 and latest 4.0 snapshot. I'm not using tomcat and Windows XP, but I am using Postgres  
15:40 <blackbird\_> vmassol: I created a regular application (w/in a minute). but now I want to modify the display theme, so that e.g. all entered information appear in a box at the upper right.  
15:45 <vmassol> blackbird\_: I guess this should be documented on the app w/minute doc page. mflorea? What I mean is that we shoudl document what are the next steps  
15:45 <vmassol> btw that's why I personally don't like too much app w/minute….  
15:46 <vmassol> it hides stuff but when you need to go further you're doomed without that knowledge  
15:46 <vmassol> blackbird\_: your app home page has an app w/minute object  
15:47 <vmassol> and there's a "view" configured by default for all pages having such an app w/minute object  
15:47 <vmassol> so what you need to do is use a custom "view"  
15:48 <pgmjsd> has joined #xwiki  
15:49 <vmassol> (getting link but my machine is building and I have over 100% cpu… takes time)  
15:49 <+mflorea> blackbird\_: I guess you want to customize the sheet used to display the application entries? Simply edit the sheet page, which is YourAppName.YourClassNameSheet  
15:49 <vmassol> mflorea: do we have a guide to go further after app/w minute generation?  
15:50 <+mflorea> We don't need one IMO. The generated app is an XWiki app so any doc on XWiki.org about developing XWiki apps is good  
15:50 <vmassol> blackbird\_: details on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Sheet+Module to set a different "view" (marius used the word "sheet" but it's the same)  
15:51 <vmassol> mflorea: then why is blackbird\_ not able to find it?  
15:52 <+mflorea> because he's no familiar with XWiki app dev. What I mean is that if you want to customize the app generated by AWM you need a bit of XWiki app dev knowledge, i.e. you need to understand what is a class/sheet/template, know a bit of velocity, etc.  
15:52 <vmassol> mflorea: btw, from your reply, each app has its own sheet?  
15:52 <vmassol> mflorea: yep exactly  
15:52 <vmassol> so why not explain that  
15:52 <vmassol> ?  
15:53 <+mflorea> each app has its own sheet to display app entries  
15:53 <vmassol> like a FAQ at the end of app w/minute doc  
15:53 <vmassol> "what should I do to customize my app's view"  
15:53 <vmassol> etc  
15:53 <vmassol> rather than tell user RTFM which is about 10000 pages on xwiki.org ,)  
15:53 <vmassol> ;)  
15:54 <+mflorea> so you want me to duplicate info?  
15:54 <vmassol> no just pointers  
15:54 <+mflorea> ie. links?  
15:54 <vmassol> contextual pointers if your prefer  
15:54 <vmassol> or show me where we already have: "what should I do to customize my app's view"  
15:55 <vmassol> my app = my app w/minute  
15:55 <vmassol> ideally  
15:55 <vmassol> this should even be in the app w/minute itself  
15:55 <vmassol> that's even better than having to add doc  
15:55 <vmassol> :)  
15:59 <blackbird\_> I agree, a link like this would be great.  
15:59 <+mflorea> I'll add some.  
16:05 <blackbird\_> great. tx!
